title: 1994년 Alexander Komarenko v. Immigration & Naturalization Service 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Alexander Komarenko v. Immigration & Naturalization Service. 판결일: 1994-09-09. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Alexander KOMARENKO, Petitioner, v. IMMIGRATION & NATURALIZATION SERVICE, Respondent
**판결일**: 1994-09-09
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Fletcher, Kozinski, Trott

## 변호인

Daniel E. Kritz, Sideman & Bancroft, San Francisco, CA, for petitioner., Francesco Isgro, Attorney, Office of Immigration Litigation, Civ. Div., U.S. Dept, of Justice, Washington, DC, for respondent.

## 인용

- 35 F.3d 432

## 판결문 요약

35 F.3d 432
    Alexander KOMARENKO, Petitioner,v.IMMIGRATION & NATURALIZATION SERVICE, Respondent.
    No. 92-70595.
    United States Court of Appeals,Ninth Circuit.
    Argued and Submitted Feb. 8, 1994.Decided Sept. 9, 1994.
    
      Daniel E. Kritz, Sideman & Bancroft, San Francisco, CA, for petitioner.
      Francesco Isgro, Attorney, Office of Immigration Litigation, Civ. Div., U.S. Dept. of Justice, Washington, DC, for respondent.
      Petition to Review a Decision and Order of the Board of Immigration Appeals.
      Before:  FLETCHER, KOZINSKI and TROTT, Circuit Judges.
      TROTT, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      On March 12, 1990, Alexander Komarenko, a former Soviet citizen and a lawful permanent resident of the United States, was convicted of assault with a deadly weapon in violation of California Penal Code Sec. 245(a)(2) and sentenced to four years of imprisonment.  The I.N.S. commenced deportability proceedings against Komarenko under 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1251(a)(2)(C) for being an alien convicted of a firearms charge.
    
    
      2
      Komarenko concedes he is deportable, but submitted to the I.N.S. applications for asylum, withholding of deportation and waiver of inadmissibility.  An Immigration Judge ("IJ") held that Komarenko was:  1) ineligible for asylum under 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1158(a);  2) "statutorily ineligible" for withholding of deportation under 8 U.S.C. Sec. 1253(h)(2)(B);  and, 3) "statutorily ineligible" for waiver of inadmissibilit...
